turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Pristina.
turn.1: What was the Yugoslav communist slogan at the time of Pristina's founding?
turn.2: The Yugoslav communist slogan at the time was uništi stari graditi novi (destroy the old, build the new).
turn.3: What did they destroy the old buildings?
turn.4: In a misguided effort to modernize the town, communists set out to destroy the Ottoman bazaar and large parts of the historic center, including mosques, catholic churches and Ottoman houses.
turn.6: A second agreement signed between Yugoslavia and Turkey in 1953 led to the exodus of several hundreds more Albanian families from Pristina.
turn.7: What did the Albanians do when they left?
turn.8: They left behind their homes, properties and businesses.
turn.10: However, this policy changed under the new constitution ratified in 1974.
turn.11: What is interesting about the communist era?
turn.12: Few of the Ottoman town houses survived the communists' modernization drive, with the exception of those that were nationalized like today's Emin Gjiku Museum or the building of the Institute for the Protection of Monuments.
